text: Hi all! Just a quick question. I want to make custom workflow actions, wrapped in a function that I can manage locally (together with other crm ui extensions) and deploy to our HS instance. Is that even possible with the HubSpot cli/crm development beta?

Currently workflow actions are only supported through public apps (marketplace apps) and also can't trigger a project function (unless you make that function the endpoint for the action, of course (although a CMS function would be the recommend course of action for this type of thing)) but this is something the team has mentioned thinking about implementing in the future

also keep in mind that just because it's called a public app that doesn't actually mean it's public facing or hosted in the marketplace you can have it only installed on one portal and not host it in the marketplace

Ok, thanks for clarifying! I guess what I need then is to figure out how a minimum «public app» that can trigger static workflow actions can look like then. I have several «custom code» actions now that I just need to get under source control. I guess there are better ways than copy/paste from my repo into the workflows manually :sweat_smile:
